official-title.#text:
To amend the World War I Centennial Commission Act to
		  provide for the designation of memorials to the service of members of the
		  United States Armed Forces in World War I, and for other
		  purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Frank Buckles World War I Memorial
			 Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

			 War I

header.#text:
Designation of
				National World War I Museum and Memorial in Kansas City, Missouri

quote.#text: National World War I Museum and Memorial

text.#text:
The Liberty Memorial of Kansas City at America’s National
				World War I Museum in Kansas City, Missouri, is hereby designated as the

The
				Centennial Commission may plan, develop, and execute ceremonies to recognize
				the designation of the Liberty Memorial of Kansas City as the National World
				War I Museum and Memorial.

header.#text:
Establishment of
				National World War I Memorial in the District of Columbia

text.#text:
The World War I Memorial Foundation may
				establish a commemorative work on Federal land in the Reserve on the National
				Mall in the District of Columbia to consist of an appropriate sculptural or
				other commemorative elements to serve as the National World War I
				Memorial.

The National
				World War I Memorial may not exceed 0.5 acres in size.

header.#text:
Compliance with
				standards for commemorative works

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall apply to the establishment of the National World
				War I Memorial in the District of Columbia and its environs.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Chapter 89 of title
				40, United States Code

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, does not apply with respect to the selection of the site for the National
				World War I Memorial.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 8908(c) of title 40, United States
				Code

header.#text:
Exception from
				prohibition on additional commemorative works in reserve

text.#text:
The
				site selected for the National World War I Memorial may not infringe upon or
				adversely impact the District of Columbia War Memorial.

The total cost to
				design and construct the National World War I Memorial may not exceed
				$10,000,000.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section
				8906(b)(1) of title 40, United States Code
